pr_title: Skip broker failure self-healing if abnormaly large amount of brokers die simultaneously

timeline.message: Skip broker failure self-healing if abnomaly large amount of brokers die simultaneously.

timeline.bodyText: Can we make this method static?
timeline.author: efeg
efeg

timeline.bodyText: Since the focus of this patch is the addition of these configs, can we also make them configurable in this patch rather postponing it?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Nit: For consistency with the relevant config: deadBrokerCount -> failedBrokerCount?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: The role of this config is not clear from the name. Should we add a comment to clarify?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText:
0.2 means that in a cluster of 9 brokers, more than 1 broker failure cannot be handled. This seems a little aggressive to me.
Can we set the default FIXABLE_BROKER_FAILURE_PERCENTAGE_UPPER_BOUNDARY  and FIXABLE_BROKER_FAILURE_UPPER_BOUNDARY to less aggressive values to avoid a dramatic change in the existing behavior?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText:
This comment seems inconsistent with the operation -- i.e. this piece of code just sets a config value.
Can we move this comment to the relevant function that interprets this config?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: This seems to subsume / hide the detail on non-fixable broker failure state. Can we make sure that this information is exposed in (1) alerts, (2) logs, and (3) anomaly detector state?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Can we clarify what it means to be fixable for broker failures?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Can we add unit tests for this new functionality?
timeline.author: efeg
efeg

timeline.bodyText: Isn't it sufficient to make this and _fixableFailedBrokerCountThreshold  a Short?
timeline.author: efeg
efeg
